title: How to Make Beer Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF.
steps.description: Line the cake pan with baking (parchment) paper.

steps.headline: Rub the butter into the flour using your fingertips.
Add the flour, sugar and fruit and mix through the buttery flour mixture.
Make a well in the centre of the mixture.
Gradually pour in the beer, aiming for the well.
steps.description: Try to keep the froth amount low.

steps.headline: Mix the beer through the mixture.
Pour the cake batter into the prepared cake pan.
Make the topping.
steps.description: Mix the equal parts of plain (all-purpose) flour, sugar and butter. Form crumbs, some much larger than others (these are very crunchy when baked).

steps.headline: Sprinkle the topping across the cake.
steps.description: Try to get it even, with larger lumps spread across at intervals.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 35-40 minutes. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: The cake can be served warm with butter or jam, or cold.

text: Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF. Line the cake pan with baking (parchment) paper. Rub the butter into the flour using your fingertips.  Add the flour, sugar and fruit and mix through the buttery flour mixture.  Make a well in the centre of the mixture.  Gradually pour in the beer, aiming for the well. Try to keep the froth amount low. Mix the beer through the mixture.  Pour the cake batter into the prepared cake pan.  Make the topping. Mix the equal parts of plain (all-purpose) flour, sugar and butter. Form crumbs, some much larger than others (these are very crunchy when baked). Sprinkle the topping across the cake. Try to get it even, with larger lumps spread across at intervals. Place in the oven. Bake for 35-40 minutes. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack. The cake can be served warm with butter or jam, or cold. Finished.
